passage:
(1) The Amazon Rainforest is often called the "lungs of the planet" because it produces about 20% of the world's oxygen. Located in South America, it spans nine countries, with the majority of it being in Brazil. This incredible natural wonder covers approximately 5.5 million square kilometers, making it the largest tropical rainforest on Earth. The Amazon is home to the Amazon River, which is the second-longest river in the world and carries more water than any other river.

(2) The biodiversity found in the Amazon Rainforest is simply astonishing. Scientists have discovered over 40,000 plant species, 1,300 bird species, 3,000 types of fish, 427 mammals, and 2.5 million different insects in this vast ecosystem. Remarkably, new species are still being found regularly. Researchers estimate that only a small percentage of the rainforest's plants and animals have been studied, suggesting that many more species remain to be discovered and examined.

(3) Unfortunately, the Amazon faces numerous threats. Deforestation is perhaps the most serious problem, with large areas being cleared for farming, cattle ranching, and logging. Climate change is also affecting the rainforest, as rising temperatures and changing rainfall patterns disrupt the delicate balance of this ecosystem. Scientists and environmental organizations are working to investigate these issues and find solutions to protect this precious natural resource.

(4) The Amazon Rainforest plays a crucial role in regulating the global climate. The trees absorb carbon dioxide, helping to reduce the effects of climate change. The forest also influences rainfall patterns across South America and beyond. When parts of the forest are destroyed, these important functions are compromised. Experts argue that protecting the Amazon is essential not just for the plants and animals that live there, but for the entire planet.

(5) Many indigenous communities have lived in the Amazon for thousands of years, developing sustainable ways to use the forest's resources. These communities have accumulated valuable knowledge about medicinal plants, sustainable hunting and fishing practices, and forest management. By working with these communities and learning from their traditional practices, we can develop better approaches to conservation. International cooperation and strong environmental policies are needed to ensure that this magnificent natural wonder is preserved for future generations to explore and appreciate.

questions.question: Which verb form correctly completes the sentence: 'She _____ English for five years.'
Choose the correct sentence:

options.A: My friend recently inherited a beautiful old Italian wooden large piano from her grandmother.
options.B: My friend recently inherited a beautiful large old Italian wooden piano from her grandmother.
options.C: My friend recently inherited an old large beautiful Italian wooden piano from her grandmother.
options.D: My friend recently inherited a large beautiful old Italian wooden piano from her grandmother.

questions.question: Which sentence is grammatically correct?

options.A: If I will see him, I will tell him.
options.B: If I see him, I would tell him.
options.C: If I would see him, I will tell him.
options.D: If I see him, I will tell him.

questions.question: Complete the sentence: 'She asked me what _____.'
Choose the correct passive form: 'The window _____ by someone yesterday.'
Which sentence is correct?

options.A: I've been to Paris last year.
options.B: I have gone to Paris last year.
options.C: I was in Paris last year.
options.D: I had been to Paris last year.

options.A: I need advice about the career choices.
options.B: I need an advice about the career choices.
options.C: I need the advice about career choices.
options.D: I need advice about career choices.

options.B: I have already seen that movie yesterday.

options.C: to study something in great detail

options.A: We need to explore more evidence before making a decision.
options.B: I will explore the test next week.
options.C: They want to explore the cave system in the mountains.
options.D: She explored the answer to the math problem.

options.A: asking questions to get more information
options.B: looking for clues in different places
options.C: examining the facts to find the truth
options.D: writing a report about what happened

options.B: They tested the movie before last night.

questions.question: Choose the correct meaning of 'disagree' in this context: 'I disagree with your point of view.'
According to paragraph 1, why is the Amazon Rainforest called the 'lungs of the planet'?

options.A: Because it covers about 5.5 million square kilometers.
options.B: Because it produces about 20% of the world's oxygen.
options.C: Because it contains the Amazon River.

questions.question: Which statement about biodiversity in the Amazon is TRUE according to the passage?

options.A: All species in the Amazon have already been discovered.
options.B: There are exactly 2.5 million insect species in the Amazon.
options.C: Scientists believe there are still undiscovered species in the Amazon.
options.D: There have always been more bird species than plant species in the Amazon.

questions.question: According to paragraph 3, what is described as the most serious threat to the Amazon?
What role does the Amazon play in relation to climate change, according to the passage?

options.A: It causes climate change by releasing carbon dioxide.
options.B: It helps reduce climate change by absorbing carbon dioxide.
options.C: It has no significant impact on climate change in South America.
options.D: It only affects the climate in South America.

questions.question: The word 'accumulated' in paragraph 5 is closest in meaning to:
What does the passage suggest about indigenous communities in the Amazon?

options.A: They contribute to deforestation by burning or cutting trees.
options.B: They have valuable knowledge about sustainable practices.
options.C: They are a recent addition to the rainforest.

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT mentioned as a reason for deforestation in the Amazon?

options.A: It is the longest river in the world.
options.B: It is the main cause of deforestation.
options.C: It carries more water than any other river.
options.D: It flows through all nine countries of the Amazon Rainforest.

questions.question: The main purpose of this passage is to:

options.A: provide information about the Amazon and its importance
options.B: compare the Amazon to other rainforests around the world
options.C: criticize governments for not protecting the Amazon
options.D: explain how to visit the Amazon as a tourist

questions.question: According to the passage, which approach would be most effective for conserving the Amazon?

options.A: Allowing only scientists to access the rainforest
options.B: Completely restricting all human activity in the rainforest of the Amazon
options.C: Learning from indigenous communities and implementing international cooperation
options.d: Focusing only on reducing climate change globally and preserve indigenous communities
